luisb1202.functions.items.elytra.item.10: §9Use third person (F5) to see the §etrail§9 it leaves!
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.1: §9Throw this item §efrom the foot slot §9of your inventory
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.2: §9with the §eQ §9button for 3 seconds, each second you will launch a
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.3: §efront coin§9 with 3 §ebouncing felines§9 in the direction you are looking.
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.4: §9These inflict §carea damage§9 every time they touch the ground,
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.5: §9and §3place torches§9 if it's dark. Make sure they
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.6: §9can bounce off walls and obstacles to maximize
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.12: §9The ability is available if the boots are §dpink§9, if they are
luisb1202.item.gatobotas.15: §9Additionally, you have a §3small chance §9to summon a
b10_ini_dialoge_1: §c Oh Eo'Thar! Look who showed up!
b10_ini_dialoge_4: Get out of here, you've already caused enough trouble!
b10_ini_dialoge_5: §c This prison of yours won't hold me much longer, Eo'thar.
b10_ini_dialoge_6: §c Do you not want these §oheroes§r§c to see how I crush your last delusions of consciousness?
b10_ini_dialoge_8: §c Come on, Eo'thar... We both know what's going to happen.
b10_ini_dialoge_9: §c You're cornered. You're alone. Stop delaying the inevitable.
b10_ini_dialoge_10:
Damn you! 
§o§7Right-click to speak with Eo'thar!
b10_info_dialog_2: §rI don't like you, but he's right. I can't hold him back much longer. I need your help to defeat him. Be sure to bring §aarea-of-effect§f and §aknockback§f weapons.
b10_info_dialog_3: §e▶ §7I don't understand what this place is. Who are you?
b10_info_dialog_5: §rAs you probably know, I was the warden of the Tower of Time, a sacred place where the energy used by the lineage of Bani to protect time converges. Thanks to that bond, I was able to take refuge in Aphofis's dreams the day the Conqueror broke in. Since then, he has tried to subjugate Aphofis using the power of the tower, and a nightmare has been growing in her mind.
b10_info_dialog_6: §e▶ §7So we're inside Aphofis's dreams? Facing her nightmares?
b10_info_dialog_7: §rYes, and I had the situation more or less under control... until you appeared. Your intrusion almost allowed Maraw'Thar to manifest in the real plane, though it was weak there, and you managed to contain it.
b10_info_dialog_8: §e▶ §7Don't worry! I can defeat it again!
b10_info_dialog_9: §rHere it's far stronger. Ever since your arrival I've barely been able to hold it back. And whether I like it or not, I can't face it alone. If this nightmare comes true, we'll be in deep trouble, so we'll have to fight together.
b10_info_dialog_10:
§rI can foresee his abilities: 
§4§l<!> WARNING <!> §r§cThis boss is tough. You might need to come back later with better gear.
b10_info_hover_11:
§c§lClock Hands (§r§c☠§c§l deadly)

§7§o(Third-person view is §b§ohighly recommended§7§o (F5) since it is necessary to have §e§overy good control§7§o over what is happening in the arena)§f 

§r§fThe §earena is a clock§r§f, and Maraw'thar will summon several §eprofane clock hands§r that will rotate across the arena. 

They cannot be jumped over, and touching one will inflict §cdamage§f that will §ctriple ☠§f every time you touch a hand again.

§4§l<!> §cThe damage from this ability §epierces §cany §eresistance §cor §eimmunity§c.
b10_info_hover_12:
§6§lDevouring Onslaught (! dangerous)

§r§fMaraw'Thar will §erepeatedly charge§f at a random player from a random angle, §ceven from behind§f. Dodge it by sidestepping. 

The damage §cdoubles§f each time it hits you, but the damage stack resets after a short time.
b10_info_hover_13:
§6§lOcular Swarm (! dangerous)

§r§fMaraw'Thar §edisappears momentarily§f and fills the entire arena floor with eyes. After a few seconds, these §cexplode§f, dealing damage that §cdoubles§f each time you are hit.

§r§fStand on the eyes that are §aclosed§f to avoid taking damage.
b10_info_hover_14:
§b§lEo'Thar Portals (! Important)

§r§fEo'Thar places §epairs of linked portals§f across the arena to help you dodge the rotating §cclock hands§f. Each portal has an arrow nearby that §bindicates§f which portal it is connected to. You can enter through one and §aexit§f through its partner instantly.
b10_info_hover_15:
§c§lGanglionic Spores (§c☠§c§l deadly)

§r§fMaraw'Thar will vilely §cvomit a spore§f onto an §bEo'Thar portal§f where there isn't already §cone§f nearby. The spore will §cblock ONLY the entrance§f of all nearby §bportals§f

§r§fSince §bEo'Thar's portals§f work in §bpairs§f, you can still §aexit§f through the linked portal even if its partner is §cblocked§f. 

§r§fYou §ccannot kill§f a spore, only §apush it away§f. Push spores using bows with §apunch§f or weapons with §aknockback§f to keep them away from the portals. However, spores are §eslightly attracted§f back toward the §bportals§f over time.

§r§fIf two spores get too close to each other, they will §cexplode§f, dealing §cmassive damage ☠§r every second. §cDon't let them merge!§f
b10_info_hover_17:
§c§lDark Ring (§c☠§c§l deadly)

§r§fMaraw'Thar summons a §cdark ring§f that either §cexpands§f or §cretracts§f from a fixed position. Touching it deals the same damage as being hit by a §cclock hand§f.

§r§fUse §bEo'Thar's portals§f to dodge these deadly rings.
b10_info_hover_18:
§c§lStalking Sentinels (§c☠§c§l deadly)

§r§fAt the end of the interphase, Maraw'Thar summons §c12 sentinels§f, and a short §ccountdown§f begins. If the timer expires and they aren't all killed, §ceveryone will die instantly§f.

§r§fBring plenty of §aarea-of-effect damage§f to clear them in time!
b10_info_hover_19:
§c§lAttract Spores (§c☠§c§l deadly)

§r§fMaraw'Thar moves to the §ccenter of the arena§f and begins to §cattract all spores§f toward himself for a few seconds. When the effect ends, §call spores will disappear§f.

§r§fRemember: if two spores §ctouch§f during the pull, they will §cexplode§f, dealing §cmassive lethal damage ☠§f every second. §cKeep them apart at all costs!§f
b10_info_dialog_20:
§rAre you sure you want to start the fight? 
§4§l<!> WARNING <!> §r§cThis boss is tough. You might need to come back later with better gear.
b10_info_dialog_22: I can lend you this, for now.
b10_fight_dialoge_0: §c Free at last! For you... it's time to die!
b10_fight_dialoge_1: I won't let you get away!
b10_fight_dialoge_4: I've placed portals! Cross them to dodge the dark clock hands.
b10_fight_dialoge_6: §c Poor Eo'Thar! Your portal magic is weakening!
b10_fight_dialoge_7: §c This is what a nightmare looks like.
b10_fight_dialoge_10: The spores are blocking my portals, §epush them away §ffrom the portals! Don't let two spores touch!
b10_fight_dialoge_11: It is attracting the spores, §cDon't let the spores touch§f!
b10_fight_dialoge_12: §c Okay, §oheroes§c, you're very entertaining... Let's play a little game!
b10_fight_dialoge_13: Focus! Don't fall for his tricks!
b10_fight_dialoge_14: §c So, the big §oheroes§c think they know how to play? I'll show you!
b10_fight_dialoge_20: Kill all the sentinels before is too late!
b10_fight_dialoge_21: §c The curtain rises again... on this delightful little game!
b10_fight_dialoge_22: And this will be the final act!
b10_fight_dialoge_27: §c No one is coming to save you, Eo'Thar. You're next!
b10_fight_dialoge_29: §c Now I know, without any doubt, that you are worthy of the destiny Thar Kroo wrote for you.
b10_fight_dialoge_30: §c§o "The liberators of §e§oAphofis§c§o, the saviors of the galaxy."
b10_fight_dialoge_31: §c Though I would call you something else... the liberators of the §eNightmare§c!
b10_fight_dialoge_32: §c For now, I shall withdraw. Prolonging this battle would no longer benefit me.
b10_fight_dialoge_33: §c I know your power now... and the board is almost prepared.
b10_fight_dialoge_34: §c When every piece falls into place, you will understand the price of your actions.
b10_fight_dialoge_37: He's gone... and this §eplace§f is getting §eunstable§f. I'll §eget you out§f!
b10_fight_dialoge_38: I'll stay behind and search for him.
b10_fight_dialoge_39: I don't have much time left... Don't let him §cmanifest in reality again§f!
baculo_eothar_1: [§e⭐§r] Scepter of Eo'Thar is on cooldown!
baculo_eothar_5: §eRight-click §9to teleport toward your line of sight,
baculo_eothar_6: §9up to 25 blocks away. Upon landing you gain §eHaste IV§9
baculo_eothar_8: §9one at your landing point, and one at your original spot,
baculo_eothar_9: §9lasting 20 seconds. You and allies may travel through the
baculo_eothar_10: §fportals §9to move back and forth. Each ally who crosses
baculo_eothar_11: §9for the first time also gains §eHaste IV§9 and §bSpeed II§9.
baculo_eothar_13: §9Additionally, a §cNightmare Eye§9 turret appears above each
baculo_eothar_14: §9portal. These eyes attack enemies within a 10-block radius,
baculo_eothar_17: §9This item has a §318-second cooldown§9. The cooldown
baculo_eothar_18: §9ticks §33 times faster§9 when no enemies are nearby.
baculo_eothar_20: §7§oYou can see how it has been tainted by Maraw'Thar.
marawthar_mistery_dia_2: §c You will pay dearly for your curiosity, §oheroes§c.
marawthar_mistery_dia_3: §c I invite you to come and visit me, at the §etop of the clocktower§c. Hhh-hah... hHAH-hAHAHA!
marawthar_mistery_dia_4: It seems that surpassing hour twelve has torn something in the fabric of this cursed place.
marawthar_mistery_dia_5: Find out what happened, and don't let your guard down.
marawthar_mistery_dia_7:
This portal leads into §ethe dream §fof someone... or something. I am a construct and cannot dream, so you will have to face the danger on your own. Are you ready? 

§7(§cWarning§7: This content is difficult, you may need to return later with better equipment.)
11_aphofis_4: §e▶ §7I'll get you out of this, I promise.
11_aphofis_5: §e... §8§o(Aphofis looks at you curiously, then tilts her head and allows you to pet it.)
luisb1202.functions.bossfight.b9.parry.i: §9§eRight-click§9 with your off-hand to cover yourself
§9§7§o(It will glow green when on cooldown)
§9If you §eblock§9 an attack, it sets the remaining block duration
§9to at least 0.5 seconds, the §3cooldown§9 §3resets§9, and you gain
§d+2 seconds of saturation I ❤§9 for all §eallies§9.
espada_conquistador_warn: §c§lA greater power has claimed the sword!
b9_dialogo_1: You arrived too late... I couldn't hold him back any longer...
b9_dialogo_2: §c This is the beginning and the end, heroes.
b9_dialogo_4: §c Your victory over The Conqueror has only led you to the worst possible fate.
b9_dialogo_5: §c Ever since I've been freed from his yoke, my power flows without limit.
b9_dialogo_6: §c How naive of §eThar Kroo§c and §eEctron§c to think they could harness my power endlessly.
b9_dialogo_7: §c Good thing the §oheroes§c arrived to set me free!
b9_dialogo_8: §c I am the Stygian Ash, the dark fire of §eBani§c, the true power of the Conqueror.
b9_dialogo_9: §c A force of nature, unstoppable, born of torture and suffering.
b9_dialogo_10: §c That is what I am, and the only thing you will know from now on.
b9_dialogo_12: §c Allow me to demonstrate to you what The Conqueror could not. HAHA-awhahahHAHa
b9_dialogo_13: I just can't believe my eyes. Talk to me now!
b9_info_eothar_0: Maraw'Thar is about to break free, and the power rising within him eclipses even the Conqueror's. Prepare yourselves, your §ctoughest battle§f is coming; you've never faced anything like this.
b9_info_eothar_2: §e▶ §7Wait. Can you explain me what is happening?
b9_info_eothar_3: Unfortunately, I cannot anticipate his moves, only offer some §ebrief§f advice. You're going in §cblind§f to the abilities he'll use.
b9_info_eothar_9:
§b§lAtacrom's Gauntlet (! Important)

§f- Maraw'Thar's attacks deal §cmassive damage§f that §ebreaks§f through any §eimmunity§f or §eresistance§f, but you can §aparry§f them using the §dGauntlet of Atacrom§f! 

- §eYou don't need to eat§f to §dregenerate ❤§f, the gauntlet gives you §esaturation§f for every parry!! 

- Block intelligently, §emissing a parry§f leaves you §cvulnerable§f while the cooldown recovers.

- Make sure §c§leveryone§f has a gauntlet, or speak with Atacrom again at the forge.

§c§lIMPORTANT:§f The attacks that are §b§lBLUE§f in color are infused with primordial dark fire. They §c§lcannot be blocked§f, only §adodged§f!
b9_info_eothar_26:
§b§lEo'Thar Help (! Important)

§fEo'Thar is greatly weakened, but with her last breath she will grant you §c§lStrength IV§f for the entire encounter. §eUse your sword§f to maximize DPS! Bows and other weapons are not as effective.
b9_info_eothar_16:
§b§lPoint of View (! Important)

§fIt is recommended to play this boss fight in §ethird-person view§f (F5). The boss moves very fast and having a wider point of view will help a lot.
b9_info_eothar_10:
§b§lMobility (! Important)

§fHaving good mobility and §cteleportation items§f is essential to get out of certain situations! Such as the §dTome of Regression§f, §dEo'thar's Scepter§f, or the §dOmegatrident§f! Speak with Koros' memories in the sanctuary to obtain a §dTome of Regression§f.
b9_info_eothar_11:
§c§lTime Echoes (§c☠§c§l deadly)

§fSometimes Maraw'Thar will leave echoes of your past selves along your path. If an echo takes damage, §cyou take it as well§f!
b9_info_eothar_12:
§c§lEnrage (§c☠§c§l deadly)

§fIf you haven't defeated the boss at the end of phase III, it will §cenrage§f, §cwiping all players out§f with unblockable attacks. §eOptimize your DPS§f!
b9_info_eothar_14:
§e§lThe Final Challenge 

§fThis boss is §c§lVERY DIFFICULT§f. It isn't meant to be defeated on the first try, but rather to be §emastered through learning its patterns§f. Don't worry if it takes you several attempts, this is the §afinal challenge§f of §5§oFinal Paradox§f!

§7(Given the difficulty of the boss, it is §erecommended to play it solo§7 for better concentration. The boss is §bvery fast§7, and a §egood connection§7 is required to fight it in §emultiplayer§7!)
b9_info_eothar_17: There isn't much time, so I'll be brief. The Conqueror gained his temporal powers by subjugating §eAphofis§f, the great cosmic serpent, using the knowledge of the §eClocktower§f. The suffering inflicted upon §eAphofis§f was so immense that it gave birth to a temporal nightmare within its mind: §cMaraw'thar§f, a being that embodies suffering itself, and feeds on it.
b9_info_eothar_19: The Conqueror was never truly aware that the real source of his power, and the dark flame with which he planned to purge the galaxy, came directly from §cMaraw'thar§f, not from §eAphofis§f.
b9_info_eothar_21: Now §eAphofis§f is tormented by this nightmare, which is on the verge of becoming real, and unstoppable, unless we stop it right now! Our chances are slim, and I hate to say it, but you are the only silver bullet capable of ending this being.
b9_info_eothar_22: §e▶ §7Why don't you consider us §eheroes§7? Have we done something wrong?
b9_info_eothar_23: By §edefeating the Conqueror§f, you have completely §cfreed Maraw'Thar§f. And now, on top of everything, he wields the power of the cosmic cores within the Conqueror's own body... The situation is desperate. It would have been better if you hadn't played at being heroes and meddled with the timelines! A future with Thar Kroo as leader would have been a paradise compared to what awaits us if this being gets his way. You want to be §eheroes§f? §eThen prove it now§f.
b9_info_eothar_24:
Are you sure you want to start the fight? 
§4§l<!> WARNING <!> §r§cThis boss is tough. It is highly §erecommended§c that you §eread the tips §cbeforehand. §7§o(They are very brief)
b9_dialogo_14: §cHeroes... be the first to witness my true power!
b9_dialogo_15: §cYou will burn in Bani's dark flames!
b9_dialogo_16: §cThar Kroo never understood the true nature of his powers! I do!
b9_dialogo_17: §cYour downfall will mark the beginning of a new era of suffering and terror!
b9_dialogo_20:
All players §cmust equip§f the §dGauntlet of Atacrom§f in their §eoff-hand§f! 

§7§o(If you've lost it, return to the forge and speak with Atacrom to obtain a new one.)
b9_dialogo_victoria_3: Aphofis' suffering... And these warriors' rage...
b9_dialogo_victoria_4: Let them carve into your cursed body...
b9_dialogo_victoria_6: §cPerhaps you have won, but this place will soon collapse and become your tomb!
b9_dialogo_victoria_7: Maybe for me, but not for these heroes!
b9_dialogo_victoria_12: With it defeated, this realm is collapsing. This nightmare cannot sustain itself any longer.
b9_dialogo_victoria_13: And as for me... my essence is bound to this place. I cannot leave with you.
b9_dialogo_victoria_14: But you still can. Let me use what remains of my echo to open a portal.
b9_dialogo_victoria_15: Just... forgive me... I misjudged you. I doubted your intentions until the very end.
b9_dialogo_victoria_16: But now, go, heroes! Leave this dying dream behind.
cld_lore_0: §c▶ §c§l[§e§l!§c§l] §eHey, do you know what happened to Aphofis?
cld_lore_1: I was just about to talk to you about that. My agents followed Aphofis all the way to §3Serpent Corpse§7. Honestly, she didn't look good.
cld_lore_3:
§7I am not sure. We'd need to take a closer look at the situation, but we really don't want to get too close to that creature. It seems to have contracted some kind of fever or something nasty. You'll have to go yourself and ask a local about it, maybe that §bZachaia§7. 


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fTalk to Zachaia in Serpent Corpse.
cld_lore_6: Yeah... After your victory over Thar Kroo the Conqueror, §eAphofis§f has returned to his home here in Serpent Corpse. But she's not doing well.
cld_lore_7: §e▶ §7But what's wrong with her? Is she sick?
cld_lore_8: I couldn't tell you... but it seems the Conqueror put her through such torment that it has made her seriously ill. She's suffering from a §efever§f, one similar to the one that killed her predecessor, §eBani§f. But this time it looks even worse.
cld_lore_9: §e▶ §7Is there anything that can be done for her?
cld_lore_10:
I don't know... She's far too young to meet the same fate as Bani, and if she does, the consequences could be catastrophic. Go to Aphofis, §etake one of her scales§f, and show it to every doctor you can find. We're running out of time... 


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fTalk to Aphofis §e§non the bridge in front of her head§f and obtain a sample scale.
cld_lore_13:
§eMaraw... Thar... §8§o(You have received an Aphofis scale in your inventory)


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fLook for clues in the §e§nscale item that is in your inventory§f and figure out who you should take it to.
cld_lore_14: §e▶ §7I don't think I understood you Aphofis... but I'll find a doctor!
cld_lore_16: §eDark stygia§9 oozes from the scale. You may not
cld_lore_17: §9know any doctors, but you do know a §eblacksmith
cld_lore_21: What do you have there? That's disgusting, it's covered in dark Stygia and slime. Where did you get this, and why are you bringing it to me?
cld_lore_22: §e▶ §7It's a scale from §eAphofis§7. She's very sick.
cld_lore_23: From §eAphofis§f? Is she contaminated? This could be very serious...
cld_lore_25: Damn... §8§o(He pauses, eyes fixed on the scale)§f The Stygian energy clinging to this... it is §eprimordial Stygia§f. The Conqueror wielded a refined version, one Éctron shaped and perfected... but this, this is §eraw Stygia§f, born from the §every source§f itself.
cld_lore_26: §e▶ §7We'll have to look for the §esource§7, right?
cld_lore_27: The origin of the Conqueror's power... everything began in the §eclocktower§f of §cHorror's Zenith§f, when the Conqueror stole its secrets to enslave §eAphofis§f... and, as if that wasn't enough, he made sure my sister §eEo'Thar§f didn't survive the events.
cld_lore_28: §e▶ §7Do you think I should go back and §einvestigate there§7?
cld_lore_29: Yes, you must investigate that place. I still can't believe that my sister, as powerful as she was, fell to the temporal nightmare you defeated without even breaking a sweat... §eSomething else is going on§f here...
cld_lore_30: §e▶ §7But what do I do once I'm there?
cld_lore_31:
My sister wouldn't like this at all, but if you §edestabilize §fthe §eclocktower§f a little, we might be able to §cuncover§f something more... Try §esetting an impossible time§f, one that goes §ebeyond §fthe clock's §e12 hours§f. 


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fGo to §cHorror's Zenith§f, destabilize the clocktower by setting a time §ehigher than 12§f, and investigate what happens.
cld_lore_34: Check your §einventory§f. I've left you some §enotes§f. Just follow the steps.
cld_lore_35: §c▶ §c§l[§e§l!§c§l] §eI defeated Maraw'Thar with your sister's help,
cld_lore_36: Wait... My sister... is she still alive? How? That shouldn't be possible...
cld_lore_37: §e▶ §7Overloading the clocktower opened a portal into Aphofis's dream. We fought the temporal nightmare again before it §efled§7.
cld_lore_38: I see... The clocktower has always been a nexus tied to Aphofis's temporal powers... By destabilizing it, I think you were able to enter Aphofis's dream and witness what is happening... just like my sister.
cld_lore_40: My theory is that Maraw'Thar is a nightmare creature, one born and fed by the suffering of others, in this case Aphofis. It likely existed dormant in her mind long before §eBani§f was ever reborn as her, but the mental torment the Conqueror inflicted to control her powers must have awakened Maraw'Thar... and that has left Aphofis seriously ill.
cld_lore_41: §e▶ §7Eo'Thar said we shouldn't let it manifest in reality again. What did she mean?
cld_lore_42: Maraw'Thar is now likely searching for every possible way to §eleak into reality§f, gain power, and §ekill Aphofis§f so it can fully manifest in our world.
cld_lore_44: One nexus it could leak through was the clocktower. Another... I fear, is the §elifeless body of Thar Kroo§f, the Conqueror, who wielded Aphofis's powers.
cld_lore_45: §e▶ §7Are you serious? His §ebody§7 is right in front of the §5monument§7.
cld_lore_46:
Heroes, you must head to the monument at once! If Maraw'Thar gains access to the Cosmic Cores, I guarantee it will be the end.  


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fGo to the §5Cosmic Monument§f and investigate.
cld_lore_50: §cDo you feel the anxiety and fear in the air, §oheroes§c?
cld_lore_51: §cYou were clever to seek me out here.
cld_lore_52: §cYou may §enot see me§c, but I stand §eso near§c that I can smell your fear.
cld_lore_53: §eThe Conqueror's §cbody is an §eanchor§c bound to the power of §eAphofis§c.
cld_lore_54: §cThrough that anchor, my presence leaks across the veil of dreams.
cld_lore_55: §cAnd though I have not yet regained the strength to manifest physically...
cld_lore_56: §cI am within reach of reclaiming that §epower§c!
cld_lore_60: §cTo abandon Thar Kroo's body in this place...
cld_lore_61: §cTo gift me victory without even realizing it!
cld_lore_63: §cI shall §eclaim§c this §ebody§c, and this §ecosmic core§c myself!
cld_lore_64: §cWith this power, §eAphofis§c will fall... and the §l§4Nightmare§c shall awaken!
cld_lore_66: §fGet over here and §etalk to me right§f now! This situation is spiraling completely out of our control!
cld_lore_68: §e... §8§o(The nightmare has sunk so deep into his mind that Aphofis no longer responds.)
cld_lore_70: No... I don't know what happened. He was fine a moment ago, and she collapsed...
cld_lore_72: She's not responding anymore, and his gaze is §ecompletely blank§f! She needs a doctor urgently!
cld_lore_73: §e▶ §7This must be the work of §eMaraw'Thar§7 with the power of the §ecosmic cores§7...
cld_lore_74:
But what are you talking about?! Go get help... run!! 


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fGo back to Atacrom and explain the situation.
cld_lore_75: §c▶ §c§l[§e§l!§c§l] §eMaraw'Thar has stolen ALL THE COSMIC CORES!!
cld_lore_76: I know! I know!!! I'm trying to think of a solution...
cld_lore_78: We... We don't know how much time we have until its next move... maybe you should go to Serpent Corpse again and see how the situation is there...
cld_lore_80:
That will give us an estimate of how quickly and desperately we need to act. 


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fGo back to §3Serpent Corpse §fand ask §dZachaia§f about §eAphofis's§f condition.
cld_lore_82: §c▶ §c§l[§e§l!§c§l] §eAphofis is dying... She's not going to make it.
cld_lore_83: The situation is §edesperate§f... With so little time, only one idea comes to mind, and I'm not even sure it will work.
cld_lore_85: When the Conqueror destroyed my body using dark fire, Koros was able to create this armor, which absorbed the remnants of my body and mind, now turned into stygia.
cld_lore_87: If I were to forge a §enew piece§f of similar armor, perhaps we could also §esiphon the nightmare stygia§f from §eAphofis's§f body and contain it.
cld_lore_89: I will forge a gauntlet for each one of you heroes!
cld_lore_91: Wait a moment, I'm §cbusy forging§f right now!
cld_lore_92:
§fI've forged a gauntlet §efor each of you§f. Distribute them among yourselves and speak to me again! 


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fTalk to Atacrom about the next step.
cld_lore_93: §fI've forged a gauntlet §efor each of you§f. Distribute them among yourselves.
cld_lore_96: §fThis enchanted gauntlet is capable of §eabsorbing§f and §eblocking§f Maraw'Thar's power.
cld_lore_98: §fGo to §eAphofis§f once more, and place your hand upon them so the gauntlet can §edrain the nightmare§f.
cld_lore_100: §fIt's important that §c§lall of you have the glove equipped§f! You may speak with me again to forge more gauntlets if needed.
cld_lore_102:
§fIf this plan fails... everything you have fought for until now could have been in vain. Good luck, heroes  


    §a§l[§e§l!§a§l] §e§lObjective: §fGo to §3§lSerpent Corpse§f and interact with §eAphofis§f.
cld_lore_105: §e... §7§o(The stygia infecting Aphofis begins swirling around the gauntlet, it looks like it's working!)
cld_lore_109: §e... §7§o(Your hand starts §ehurting intensely§7, and you feel a §esupernatural force§7 getting in the way.)
cld_lore_111: §e... §7§o(You feel that instead of absorbing the nightmare, the §cnightmare has begun to absorb you§7.)
cld_lore_112: §e▶ §7The pain is unbearable now, but you choose to endure bravely!
cld_lore_113: §eARGWGGRGRR!! §7§o(You're on the verge of collapsing, you can't endure any longer. You feel your body §csuccumb§7 to the §cnightmare§7 as it §cpulls§7 you toward an §cunknown place§7.)
cld_lore_117: §cAdvancing without fear, straight into the wolf's maw...
cld_lore_118: §cI await you at the end of this hall... impatiently... §oMwahahaha!
cld_lore_119: §4§l<!> §cYou must have the Atacrom Gauntlet equipped in your off-hand!
cld_lore_121: §4§l<§c§l!§4§l>§c To move forward, all players §emust be in this area§c, with the §eAtacrom Gauntlet equipped§c in the §eoff-hand§c. If you wish to return to the sanctuary, click
nightmare_cosmic_core_6: Once again, your journey has reached its end.
nightmare_cosmic_core_7: The galaxy, and Aphofis, may finally rest.
nightmare_cosmic_core_8: Freed from the tyranny of Thar Kroo, and the malice of Maraw'Thar.
nightmare_cosmic_core_9: Heroes... my essence fades as the nightmare ends.
nightmare_cosmic_core_10: Go now, and see if §eAphofis§f is safe...
nightmare_cosmic_core_11: Tell my brother §eAtacrom§f that I §elove§f him.
nightmare_cosmic_core_13:
§b§l<!> §7§oThis expansion was created with great care for everyone who has supported the map throughout these years, and it marks the definitive conclusion of Final Paradox. From the heart and with great enthusiasm, I hope you enjoyed it a lot.

 ~ luisb1202. 

Take a photo at the monument and share it on Twitter (X) with the hashtag #FinalParadox so that §bluisb1202§7, §eDarthVid§7 and §cElRichMC§7 can see that you have defeated Maraw'Thar!
nightmare_cosmic_core_14: §6§l<!> §fIf you want to help us continue creating amazing experiences in Minecraft, consider supporting §6§lRichMaps§f by clicking
cld_lore_124: §e... §7§o(Aphofis turns her head and looks at you gratefully and happily)
cld_lore_127: §e▶ §7No chains bind you anymore, Aphofis. Your legend will endure!
cld_lore_130: Phew... that was a relief. I worried too much when I saw how the nightmare absorbed you as you placed your hand on Aphofis.
cld_lore_132: I'm glad you're in one piece! And I'm glad Aphofis is safe and sound... at last! You should probably §etalk to Aphofis§f, I think she is §egrateful§f to you.
cld_lore_134: §a▶ Maraw'Thar has fallen. Your sister... vanished along with the nightmare. She said she loved you.
cld_lore_135: I assumed that when the nightmare disappeared, my sister would fade away as well... It is hard. I will miss her, but I will remember her courage and sacrifice forever.
cld_lore_137: I will also remember your valor, heroes. Once again, you emerge victorious from the most terrifying situations.
cld_lore_139: Meanwhile, I will keep trying to find a new purpose... now that my vengeance for my sister and for the galaxy has been fulfilled.
cld_lore_141: By the way... you should go and see how §eAphofis§f is doing.
cld_lore_143: §a▶ In the end, I went to check on how Aphofis was doing.
cld_lore_144: How did it go? I've taken so much advantage of the Conqueror's absence from my trade routes that I could barely keep up with you.
cld_lore_145: §e▶ §7Don't worry, it's normal you didn't even notice... it was nothing.
cld_lore_146: From the way you say that, I'm not sure whether I'd rather know more or stay blissfully ignorant...
cld_lore_147: §e▶ §7I only had to defeat what, until recently, was the most powerful entity in the galaxy...
cld_lore_148: I expected nothing less from the heroes of this galaxy. Safeguarding the integrity of my business once again. And now that the galaxy is out of danger... what will you do?
cld_lore_149: §e▶ §7I think I'll take some loooong vacations.
cld_lore_150: That sounds good. Rest is important... I should probably take a break as well...
cld_lore_153: So, would you like to keep listening to the §esanctuary§f music? §7§o(This option only affects the sanctuary. The map's general music volume is controlled via Jukebox/Noteblocks volume slider; don't set it to 0 or you'll miss the music from cinematics and bosses).
cld_lore_158:
§e=======================================
§e§l<!> §fThere are still §eloose threads§f. Follow them, and the map will reveal an §eending few have seen§f. Seek this sigil: §c§l[§e§l!§c§l]
§e=======================================
cld_lore_161: §e▶ §7Wait, But I §ealready defeated Maraw'Thar§7 with your sister's help!
b11_text_9: §e The Conqueror? Ectron? You are the Conqueror... You did this to me... I can't endure it...
b11_text_10: §e §lYOU§e... you are the ones who broke me!
b11_text_13: §e I no longer know who I am...
b11_text_14: §e Have you come for my cosmic core? TO EXTEND MY TORMENT?
b11_text_15: §e §lMARAW'THAR§e HAS SHOWN ME... THE TRUTH, CONQUEROR...
b11_text_16: §e It is already inside your mind as well...
b11_text_17: §e Let me show you the truth...
b11_text_18: Madness has consumed her, heroes... We must put an end to her suffering.
b11_text_19: Speak to me. I stand before the Queen!
b11_text_20: Once a §emajestic§f and revered being, now just an §eabject aberration§f that mistakes us for the Conqueror. We must free it from its torment to recover the §ecosmic core§f.
b11_text_21: §e▶ §7How can I §ebeat§7 The Queen of the Hive?
b11_text_22: §e▶ §7How did she end up like this?
b11_text_28:
§e§lBloodhoney Bolt

§fAfter a §eshort cast§f, the queen §cspits§f a bloodhoney bolt §c§lforward§f and §c§ltoward§f each §6honey mummy§f and §cBloodhoney Spawn§f, damaging both players and §emummies§f.

§b§lTip:§f step out of the boss's front and avoid standing between the boss and a mummy.
b11_text_30:
§6§lHivebreaker (! dangerous)

§fThe boss will perform a §esequence§f of these two attacks:

§6§lGround Slam:§f The queen smashes one §centire half§f of the arena, dealing damage to §eplayers§f and §emummies§f.

§6§lRadial Slam:§f The queen spins in place, dealing damage to all nearby §eplayers§f and §emummies§f in a circular area.
b11_text_32:
§e§lAssault from Below

§fThe queen §edives§f underground and repeatedly §eleaps§f at players, §bincreasing speed§f each time.

This attack does not damage mummies, only players.
b11_text_34:
§c§lDeranging Scream (§r§c☠§c§l deadly)

§fThe queen inhales briefly, then unleashes a §eterrifying scream§f that §edeals damage§f every 1.5 seconds for 4.5 seconds §7(§e3 ticks§7 in total)§f to all §eplayers§f and §emummies§f in her line of sight.

§b§lTip:§f Keep a §emummy§f at §e4 HP§f and §chide behind§f it when the scream occurs. If the mummy has 3 HP or less, it will die mid-scream, leaving you §cexposed§f.
b11_text_36:
§6§lEnrage (! dangerous)

§fDuring the §efinal phase §7§o(phase 3)§f, the queen becomes §cenraged§f and performs §e§lBloodhoney Bolt§f and §6§lGround Slam §bfaster§f.
b11_text_37: The Conqueror is searching for a powerful being to steal its strength and carry out his crusade. It seems this was his first test subject, a failed one. The queen is trapped in a deep nightmare she cannot escape from, and we are her only way out.
b11_text_40: §cI am so sorry... you deserved better... you poor soul...
b11_text_41: §cAnd I am sorry for you as well, my champions, for having to witness this.
b11_text_42: §cSuch a kind soul with a great heart... It is painful to see what they... turned her into...
b11_text_43: §cI fear the Conqueror's next target may be the cosmic serpent §eBANI§c...
b11_text_50: §eJoin me in my nightmare of blood and honey.
b11_text_54: §eYou will feel every drop of my suffering!
b11_text_55: §eThis is all your fault! I was not always like this...
b11_text_57: The Queen has §cenraged§f, now her attacks go §efaster§f!
b11_text_60: Greetings, heroes. As you can see, I can manifest §eechoes of myself§f whenever there is §esomething important§f you need §eto know§f.
b11_text_62:
The §ehoney§f in this place still retains the Queen's original power. §eStepping on it§f grants §bspeed I§f, §ehaste I§f, §6resistance I§f, and §6fire resistance§f for §350 seconds§f, and also §acleanses poison§f.

This is very useful, as enemies in this area wield §6fire§f and §apoison-based§f abilities.
b11_text_64: Since the §eConqueror experimented§f on the Queen to §esteal her power§f, she §elost herself§f within her own mind. The entire hive followed the same fate. Since then, they have been nothing more than disturbed insects, without direction or purpose.
b11_text_66: Stepping on §ehoney§f removes §apoison§f and grants §6resistance§f, §6fire resistance§f, §bspeed§f, and §ehaste§f for 50 seconds.
b11_text_67: The §ehoney§f is §esticky§f, you might be able to use it to §eslide down safely§f!
b11_text_68: The §ehoney§f is §esticky§f, you might be able to use it to §eslide down safely§f!
b11_text_71: §6§l/§f§l9§f Maldini's cats. Come back to him when you have them §eall§f to receive your §ereward§f!
b11_text_73: Well done! You have rescued §a§lall §fMaldini's cats. Come back to him to receive your §ereward§f!
b11_text_74: §fThis cat belongs to §eMaldini§f. Talk to §ehim§f at the §6first intersection§f to learn what to do with the cat.
maldini_portal_2: §9When §ethrown on the ground§9, it will generate a vortex
maldini_portal_3: §9that will teleport all nearby §ecats§9 back home.
maldini_portal_4: §9The item is §econsumed§9 on use, but you can ask
atacrom_book_lore_1:
§4§lStep 1/5:

§3Reset all echoes§8 and obtain an §3Epochwalker §8by speaking with §dKoros's Echo§8.§7§o (x: 887, y: 34, z: 1679)
atacrom_book_lore_2:
§4§lStep 2/5:

§8Drop the §3Epochwalker§8 and set the time to §3§lIX§8 on the §3blue hand§8.
atacrom_book_lore_3:
§4§lStep 3/5:

§8Activate Tower §lIX §7§o(x: 897, y: 23, z: 1745) §8by looking at it §3from the §lfront§8. 

Remember: to activate a tower §6everybody§8 must §3sneak§8 and §3look§8 at the §ceye§8.
atacrom_book_lore_4:
§4§lStep 4/5:

§8Activate Tower §lIX§8 again by looking at it §4from the §lback§8.
atacrom_book_lore_5:
§4§lStep 5/5:

§8Activate Tower §lIX§8 once more by looking at it §3from the §lfront§8.

With this, you're setting the time to IX + XI (9 + 11), which exceeds 12!
atacrom_book_lore_6:
§4§lThe end:

§8With this, you're setting the time to IX + XI (9 + 11), which exceeds 12!
luisb1202.functions.carga_lanas.2_naranj: §4§o§l<Thar Kroo>§c We must §eretrieve the cosmic core§c from this place... and perhaps grant peace to that poor creature.
§4§o§l<Thar Kroo>§r§l Koros §cawaits you inside. §rSpeak§c with him.
maldini_1: Thank you so much, adventurer. I am truly grateful to you!
maldini_2: §e▶ §7So, what else have you been up to?
maldini_4: Feel free to take a look at my goods if you like, adventurer!
maldini_11:
At last! My cats §eare all together§f again. My gratitude is immense, adventurer, and a promise is a promise. Take my §emagical boots§f! With them, §emy cats§f will be able to §ehelp you§f wherever you may be!

   §a§l+ §eYou receive: §6- ★ §6§l§oMaldini's Feliboots§6 ★ -
b10_h6_blocked_teleport_eothar: The spore is blocking the portal! Push it away from the portal!
b10_h4_split_spores_eothar: Two spores are too close! §cPush them away§f or they'll keep triggering massive explosions!
lana_0_lore_2: Your hands grow numb, you should look for a §ecampfire§f and regain §ewarmth§f!
lana_0_lore_5: When your warmth bar is above §3§l90%§f, you activate the §6§lBlazing Phase§f, granting §cStrength§f and §bSpeed§f. During the §6§lBlazing Phase§f, the §ewarmth bar will glow§f with an §eanimation§f.
lana_0_lore_6: Your §espawnpoint§f is now bound to this §ecampfire§f.
lana_0_lore_8: Above your health bar you will see a §enew warmth bar§f:
lana_0_lore_9: §eYou will lose warmth§f gradually over time, but §eespecially§f when §ctaking damage§f.
lana_0_lore_11:
By §eapproaching§f a campfire, you set it as your §e§nnew spawn point§f.

Additionally, staying §enear a campfire§f restores your §6warmth bar§f up to a maximum of §350%§f.
lana_0_lore_13: Each time you §edefeat an enemy§f or §ebreak a spawner§f, it increases by §38%§f.
lana_0_lore_14: §e▶ §7Alright, but why are you telling me all this?
lana_0_lore_15:
If your warmth bar is at:

§3§l0%§f you will §bfreeze§f and receive §7Mining Fatigue I§f.
§3§l45%§f or more, you gain §eHaste I§f + §dRegeneration I§f.
§3§l65%§f or more, §eHaste II§f and §6Resistance§f.
§3§l90%§f or more, §cStrength I§f and §bSpeed§f.
lana_0_lore_17: Here begins your search, chosen hero. These lands, once fertile, were frozen when the Conqueror's darkness swallowed the sun. The nomads left campfires lit with the fire of the sacred serpent §eBANI§f. Use them wisely, or you will §cfreeze§f to death.
lana_0_lore_19: §e▶ §7Who the hell is talking to me? Show yourself!
lana_0_lore_20: Patience, hero. Our paths will cross soon. We will meet on the other side.
lana_0_lore_23: This place is §eunstable§f. I don't think that was the last one to fall. Those §eicicles§f will §bfreeze§f you on impact, and your §cenemies§f even §emore§f...
lana_0_lore_25: This area is §eunstable§f. Massive §eicicles§f can fall and §bfreeze§f you on impact, but staying §aunder cover§f or near a §acampfire§f will keep you §asafe§f. They can also be used to stun and deal extra damage to your §cenemies§f.
b11_text_23: The battle has three phases, and two interphases. She only §ereceives damage§f on the §ehead§f. These are her abilities:
b11_text_26:
§b§lBloodhoney Homeostasis (! Important)

§fThe queen always keeps §e4 Honey Mummies§f in the arena. Killing one §eimmediately§f spawns §eanother§f.
Mummies are §eimmobile§f and deal §3no damage§f. After §c§l4 hits§f, they §cdie§f.

If §aYOU§f land the §afinal hit§f, the mummy §adies safely§f. 
If the §cQUEEN§f lands the §cfinal hit§f, it becomes a §cBloodhoney Spawn§f that will §cchase§f and §cattack§f you. If the §cBloodhoney Spawn§f is not eliminated within §e10 seconds§f, it will enrage, §clethally ☠§f boosting its damage! 

Mummies show hit progress on their health bar and §cglow red§f when §eone hit away§f.

The mummies also drop §efood§f, §earrows§f, and §eweapons§f.

§b§lTip:§f finish the mummies when they are at one hit remaining, to save time.
the_fall_1: I don't usually suggest §erisky ideas§f, but I think you should §ejump§f into this §epit§F with a §bTome of Invulnerability§f to survive the damage. It's the fastest and safest option.
the_fall_2: §e▶ §7Can you give me a §bTome of Invulnerability§7?
the_fall_5: Sure, here you go. I've also reset the cooldown on your tomes! Good luck jumping!
the_fall_7: During this section, I'll give you §aJump Boost V§f to help you get over the obstacles!
reina_miel_5: §9You wield the §eBloodhoney Homeostasis§9. You will summon
reina_miel_7: §9players move away from it, §eyou will summon a new one§9. The
reina_miel_8: §6mummy§9 will die upon taking §cany kind§9 of damage, generating
reina_miel_9: §9a §epure crystallized honey explosion§9 that will deal
reina_miel_10: §cmassive damage§9 to nearby enemies, and §3stun§9 them in
reina_miel_11: §9honey for 5 seconds. The explosion will §aheal§9 also
reina_miel_17: §9so §3make sure to explode it§9 §3when it is wise§9!
reina_miel_19: §7§o(Special abilities do not trigger the mummy, so
reina_miel_20: §7§ouse a melee hit or an arrow shot)
altar_heroes_1: §8These are the first players who completed §5§nFinal Paradox§8.
altar_heroes_4: §c§lWarning! §8§oActivating this may cause a lag spike!
altar_heroes_5: §8Thank you to everyone who played and streamed their Final Paradox gameplay on §5Twitch§8 or §cYouTube§8. We tried to watch as many as we could, and it was an §6unforgettable experience§8.
6_msg_levitar: Phew, that was close. It seems that when you fall into the §dvoid§f, a §bgravitational anomaly§f gives you §e10 seconds§f of grace to §erecover§f!
